climbs.name: Little Nosey Girl Who Should Have Minded Her Manners

content.description: Slightly shorter and a little more difficult than it's neighbor, Grumpy Old Men. Gain a short, right facing flake and follow it up to a section of smaller holds with big feet. A few harder moves gain easier climbing to the top. To get down, down climb the ramp that diagonals leftward across the face.
content.protection: Pads. Highball and an uneven landing. Falling is not advised.
content.location: Start off the right side of a pile of boulders/flakes, in the middle of the wall.

content.description: This highball outing is tons of fun. Follow the right facing flake all the way to the top. To get down, down climb the ramp that diagonals leftward across the face.
content.protection: Pads, with a flat landing, but don't fall...
content.location: Starts on the right side of the face, using the flake systems to gain the primary flake above.

content.description: Start matched on the chalky crimp, and then head up the face, staying right of the arete/ramp.
content.location: Far left side of Family Wall, just right of a huge pine tree.
